conclusion: Understanding the setup of an equilateral triangular conductor frame in a magnetic field.
Points A and B are connected to a power supply, and current flows through the frame.
The current path is not immediately obvious due to the loop structure.
AB is highlighted in red, suggesting it is the primary current path.
Current will distribute based on resistances; resistance is proportional to length.
Resistance of AB is R_ab, and AC and CB together have resistance R_ac + R_cb.
R_ac = R_cb = R_ab because AC and CB have the same length as AB.
Total resistance from A to B through AC and CB is 2*R_ab.
Most current should flow through AB due to lower resistance.
Current through AB, I_ab, is (2/3) * I_total.
Current through AC and CB combined is (1/3) * I_total.
Current through AC and CB individually is (1/3) * I_total.
Ampere force on AB is given by F = B * I_ab * L.
